snippet: Mrs. Clinton has a chance to become the first female nominee from either major party. First, she will be pushed to explain why she wants the job.
abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton announces her candidacy for 2016 presidential nomination, releasing online video and ending two years of speculation; enters field with no formidable competition, and could well become first female nominee from either party; video portrays diversity of voters and their concerns, turning to Clinton herself only near end; Clinton still faces challenge of explaining to voters why she wants job and is best fit for it.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton has a chance to become the first female nominee from either major party. First, she will be pushed to explain why she wants the job.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Starts to Detail Rationale for Run as Campaign Begins
headline.print_headline: Clinton Ends Speculation, Entering the 2016 Contest
